question.xref: DES s1, HC r90, HC r96
question.text: Your doctor has given you a course of medicine. Why should you ask how it will affect you?

explanation.text: Always check the label of any medication container. The contents might affect your driving. If you aren’t sure, ask your doctor or pharmacist.

answer.text: Drugs make you a better driver by quickening your reactions
You will have to let your insurance company know about the medicine
Some types of medicine can cause your reactions to slow down
The medicine you take may affect your hearing
